tasks.title: Minimum hosting requirements
tasks.explications: Make sure your hosting plan at least supports the following setup. But you should make sure you fulfill the recommended setup. Note: Administrative tasks may consume much more memory!

explicationlist.explicationitem: Nginx or Apache with mod_rewrite module
Minimum 40MB memory allocated to PHP for a single sites (at least 64MB for multisite)
At least 60s PHP max execution time

tasks.title: Recommended hosting requirements
tasks.explications: Depending on your setup (theme / used plugins) you may consider the recommended setup.

explicationlist.explicationitem: MySQL 5.6 or greater OR MariaDB 10.0 or greater
Nginx or Apache with mod_rewrite module
64MB memory allocated to PHP for a single sites (128MB for multisite)
120s PHP max execution time for very complex sites and/or backend operations

tasks.title: Set up your SSL certificate
tasks.explications: It is recommended to install and run WordPress using HTTPS. So it would be best to set up a SSL certificate before setting up WordPress, because WordPress uses absolute paths that will be stored within the database. Fixing those after installing WordPress after installation is simply not neccessary. So make sure to get it set up before installation.

tasks.title: Set up your host
tasks.explications: Set up your host from which you´ll want to serve your WordPress installation. Make sure that it will serve your installation via HTTPS by setting up a 301-directive.

tasks.title: Set up your database
tasks.explications: Set up your database and make sure to give it a non-guessable name for security reasons. It should not exactly match the hosts/domains name.

tasks.title: Download WordPress from Wordpress.org
tasks.explications: Make sure to download WordPress from a reliable source - WordPress.org. There are alternatives available like WProller that allow you to download a customized installation with preconfigured themes and plugins, but those may not always included the latest versions. However you can/should update those after completing the installation.

links.text: Download a customized WordPress from WProller.com

tasks.title: Transfer files via FTP
tasks.explications: Unpackage the download to your local computer and upload the content of the "wordpress" folder to your host via FTP, NOT the "wordpress" folder itself - otherwise you´ll need to access it via "www.examplehost.com/wordpress" later !
